Key Match Events: Luka Doncic had 27 points and 13 assists to lead the host Dallas Mavericks past the Chicago Bulls 119-99.
The Mavericks scored 21 fastbreak points and led by as much as 30.
The Bulls shot just 41.9 percent from the floor and were 12-of-42 (28.6 percent) from 3-point range.
Nikola Vucevic finished with a team-high 14 points in 25 minutes.
Kyrie Irving had 15 of his 17 points in the first quarter as Dallas led 32-24 after 12 minutes.
Josh Giddey made a 3-point shot to help pull the Bulls to 43-37 in the second quarter.
Doncic sparked a 10-2 Dallas run with four free throws and a short jumper to push the lead back up to double digits.
Dallas went on a 13-0 run to open the second half, capped by a three by Klay Thompson to make it 69-45.
Doncic went to the bench for good with 7:24 left and the Mavericks up 97-74.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Mavericks played without center Dereck Lively for a second straight contest due to a shoulder injury.
Forward P.J. Washington missed the game with a knee sprain.
Daniel Gafford took a knee to the thigh from Vucevic in the second quarter and did not return.
